paragraph.heading: 2Compiling
paragraph.paragraph:
To compile the example:
Start Visual Studio .NET
Choose Open Project from the File menu.
Navigate to <Eiffel_ENViSioN!_installation_path>\compiler\examples\(.net version)\winforms\date_time_picker\ and select date_time_picker.eifp
Clicking open loads the selected project
Launch EiffelStudio.
Select Use existing Ace (control file) and click OK
Browse to Eiffel54\examples\dotnet\winforms\control_reference\date_time_picker_ctrl\
Choose the Ace file for the version of the .net framework you are running
Choose the directory where the project will be compiled, by default the same directory containing the Ace file.
Click OK.
paragraph.heading: 2Running
paragraph.paragraph: After launching the application, you will see a window displayed with a similar appearance to the one above. On the left side of the main window a date is displayed in a COMBO_BOX. Clicking on this COMBO_BOX and a CALENDAR control will appear showing the same date than in the COMBO_BOX. On the the right side of the main window are the commands to control the format of the displayed date and the style of the CALENDAR control.

Clicking on the "Change font" button and a
/images/dotnet_samples/change_font_dialog.png change font dialog box will appear.

Clicking on the "Change color" button and a
/images/dotnet_samples/date_time_picker_change_color_dlg.png dialog box will appear that will permit you to customize the color appearance of the calendar though a
/images/dotnet_samples/date_time_picker_change_color_dlg.png color dialog box .
paragraph.heading: 2Under the Hood
paragraph.paragraph: This application uses several different controls, but tend to show how to parameter the CALENDAR control using the FONT_DIALOG and COLOR_DIALOG.
When one of the buttons "Change font" or "Change color" is pressed, an event is launched and open the corresponding dialog box.
When the entry in the COMBO_BOX format change, an event is launched and modify the format of the displayed date.
